instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_LEFT: What is HALL_SENSOR_LEFT? HALL_SENSOR_LEFT is a signal from the hall sensor on the left side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
No liquid damage, 3ports measure 4.98v .29a but one only mesures 5v 0.12a
<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> measures 2.5v on the 3 ports and 0v on the 1 port (bottom right when using macbook normally)

Are schematics available for this yet? im using a 000293

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Please disregard just saw Louis has a video for charging issues.
replaced the CD3215C that was getting hot and now all working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
This board has a wierd issue where it doesnt go to sleep properly hence draining battery very quickly.
when put to sleep machine remains warm after a few hours, also if I leave the capslock key on and put it to sleep the LED never goes out

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal in sleep mode.
All S0 voltages should go down; check that too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> while sleep 3.48v(open) 0.1v(closed)
<SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> are up
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> fluctuating bet 0.2-0.7v

Just noticed when put to sleep with capslock on afte rabout 20seconds the light goes out for 1 second then comes back on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
When sleeps, no S0 voltage should be on.
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> should go down for this.

BTW, do you reffer to put system in sleep mode from software (with trackpad), or just closing lid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> stays high, I've tried both methods and both have the same results.

Worth an ME region cleaning?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> goes low in both cases?
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT.
If any bad, check <SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT and <CHIP>U5255</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> only goes low when lid is closed even when put to sleep with trackpad, all <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> stuff seems to be measuring right

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: Can you check if backlight goes off when close the lid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: yes backlight goes off when lid is closed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
So the system receives correct signal, but keeps S0 state active; this is really strange.
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> remains high too?

Disconnect any unnecessary device from the board, like TP/KB, etc.
Use USB mouse and keyboard; see if any behaviour changes...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
yeah really weird screen goes off and when i wake it its at the login screen but it just keeps the machine in an s0 state

Unplugged everything except screen still same behavior

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
just noticed the capslock LED keeps cycling, i timed it
LED stays on for 11.5seconds then turn off for 1.5s and the cycle repeats

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Try clean ME, just in case.
But doesn't look like issue here.
Don't forget to make a backup first.
Also try your test USB OSX, to discard a software issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: Tried to clean ME and different OSX, issue persists

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Same thing on battery alone, without charger?
Could be some wake signal issue.
Inspect if you moved something on the board when replaced the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
same thing on batt or charger. Area is clean arround <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>.
When I plug something into the port that the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> was for it goes to sleep properly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: So that port works correctly, no sleep issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: if i plug something into the port then the machine works properly no sleep issue, if i plug it into other ports issue persists

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Did you solder the same <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip, from donor?
Be aware of termination, aka C00, B03...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message: took it from a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> same CD3215C00

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
Change, or reflow that chip.
Or change the other <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips from the board; as your issue seems to be related with them...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power, one port measures 5v 0.12a
threads.message:
reflowed chip same prob
Changed chip same prob

only have 1 other chip still waiting for new ones.
